intro: Solanum incanum, commonly known as the white nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are usually clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a yellowish berry that contains several seeds. Solanum incanum is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
